meanings.definition: A small donkey used as a pack animal.
meanings.sent1: The burros carried heavy loads up the mountain.
meanings.sent2: We saw a group of burros on the trail, each carrying supplies.
meanings.sent3: The burros seemed to be chatting amongst themselves as they walked.
meanings.sent4: The burros' determination to carry the load reminded me of our team's resilience.
meanings.sent5: The image of the burros trudging along stayed with me long after we left.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight used in Spanish-speaking countries, equal to about 25 pounds.
meanings.sent1: She bought a bag of rice that weighed ten burros.
meanings.sent2: The package was heavy, weighing almost two burros.
meanings.sent3: Carrying groceries felt like lugging around a few burros.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the books was equivalent to three burros on my back.
meanings.sent5: The burros of potatoes she carried home made her arms ache.
